### isConcrete() {#afaa2e182c896e42578a6606bc7a638c8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool FieldInit::isConcrete () const"
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Is this a concrete and fully resolved value without any references or stuck operations?

Unset values are concrete.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h/#l01392">1392</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h">Record.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/record-cpp/#l02499">2499</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/record-cpp">Record.cpp</a>.

### resolveReferences() {#ad617a1e50a36876352cc0dc9228636a0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const Init &#42; FieldInit::resolveReferences (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/resolver">Resolver</a> &amp; R) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This function is used by classes that refer to other variables which may not be defined at the time the expression is formed.

If a value is set for the variable later, this method will be called on users of the value to allow the value to propagate out.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h/#l01389">1389</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h">Record.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/record-cpp/#l02477">2477</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/record-cpp">Record.cpp</a>.
